title: The Mind of Evil
dialogue_triumphs: Kettering: 'Science has abolished the hangman's noose and substituted this infallible method.' The Doctor: 'People who talk about infallibility are usually on very shaky ground.'
The Doctor: 'Do you think for once in your life you could arrive before the nick of time?'
dialogue_disasters: Mike Yates describes Chin Lee as 'quite a dolly'.
goofs: How does the water get into the drowned man's lungs if he's only killed by his fear of drowning?
During a fight sequence in which water is spilled, the Master twice slips in the puddle.
In the office scene in episode four a female sneeze from the studio is heard.

continuity_notes.name: The Doctor
continuity_notes.description: The Third Doctor, currently exiled on Earth and working with UNIT.
continuity_notes.current_status: Claims to be a personal friend of Mao Tse-Tung and seems to support capital punishment in episode one.

continuity_notes.name: The Master
continuity_notes.description: The Doctor's nemesis, posing as Swiss scientist Emil Keller.
continuity_notes.current_status: Has successfully 'treated' 112 prisoners with the Keller process.

continuity_notes.name: UNIT
continuity_notes.description: United Nations Intelligence Taskforce, set up to deal with unusual threats to Earth.
continuity_notes.current_status: Providing security for the World Peace Conference.

continuity_notes.name: The Brigadier
continuity_notes.current_status: Can put a D-notice on the press, uses call-sign 'Jupiter'.

continuity_notes.name: Keller Machine
continuity_notes.description: Device that supposedly extracts negative impulses from the brain, actually contains a Mind Parasite.
continuity_notes.current_status: Being used to 'treat' prisoners at Stangmoor Prison.

technobabble: The Keller process supposedly 'extracts negative impulses from the brain'.
roots: The opening line is 'Looks like Dracula's castle'.
The mental subjugation of convicts as seen in episodes of The Avengers ('The Wringer', 'The Fear Merchants'), The Prisoner ('A Change of Mind') and Star Trek ('Dagger of the Mind').
links: The Doctor mentions the destruction of the alternate Earth in 'Inferno'.
The Keller Machine shows images of the Doctor's foes, including a Dalek, a Cyberman, an Ice Warrior, a 'Silurian', a War Machine, a Zarbi and Koquillion.

locations.name: H. M. Stangmoor Prison
locations.description: Prison where the Keller Machine is being used.

locations.name: World Peace Conference
locations.description: International conference where UNIT is providing security.

untold_adventures: The Doctor says he once shared a cell in the tower of London with Sir Walter Raleigh ('a very strange chap… Kept going on about this new vegetable he'd discovered').
additional_notes: The Master's inferiority complex about the Doctor is revealed, explaining many of his subsequent actions. When disguised as a telephone engineer, the Master wears a black (or dark blue) and white football scarf, possibly indicating support for Fulham, Newcastle United, Notts County or Tottenham Hotspur.
bottom_line: A hugely expensive James Bond-style political thriller, with a high action content, lots of motorcycle chases, and some interesting things to say about international relations.
